rComments: I might sound like just another salty student because of the grade I got, but this man needs his EXACT words to get the question right otherwise you will lose marks. He also uses a lot of hyperspecific examples he only mentioned once in class, and the questions are usually terribly worded. Also in love with flat fish. Also maybe racist. I'd avoid

Dr. Chapleau was easily the best teacher I had all year. His lectures were always interesting and of great quality. He put lots of effort into making his prerecorded lectures during the pandemic. The tests were fair but be sure to listen to all the videos. Best advice, he marks key words so pay attention to the words in bold on his slides.

Loved his lectures and was a very engaging teacher (especially during covid), made me enjoy his class. However, his midterms and exams are very demanding (in a very limiting amount of time) it requires alot of studying.,

Chapleau was super enthusiastic and made most material more engaging than it probably should be. Tests are very specific so be sure to hit every major point you can think of for a given question. The tests were open book but you are given so little time that you can't really search through your notes effectively so do study.

At the beginning of the year I disliked him ngl but this guy is extremely intelligent and knows how to explain things. Take a lot of notes, memorize every keyword and story and learn to be time efficient in his exams. A lot of controversy went around about this prof during the year and a lot of it is untrue.

not sure what these reviews are on. he is charismatic and makes lectures interesting BUT his tests are overly specific and although open book, hard to complete in the time given. take him if youre a fish lover i guess. felt uncomfortable in his class knowing hes one of the profs that thinks its ok to say the n word as a white man!

King Midas must have touched Dr. Chapleau, because he's solid gold. I looked forward to every lecture. The BIO 1130 team put together a great online course. The lectures were smooth, though you have to pay attention, he tests you on his stories, which you may forget to write down because you're so engaged. Tests are tough, tricky MCs and keyword SA
THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER!!!! hes so amazing and his lectures are so helpful. We share the same views and i wish i can give him more than 5 stars !!!!

Hes really passionate about what he does the lectures are really interesting and he does know how to make the class interesting He listens to the students and is ready to make change according to what is needed However, hes a tough grader. The exams are pretty straightforward to the lectures but one little mistake will lose lots of points

His lectures are extremely boring. His exams are tough and you most likely won't do well unless you've memorized every word he said throughout his lectures. His exams are basically trick questions in that sense, as he's looking for very specific keyword answers. He's not generous with his marking and realistically, you might not pass all the exams.

I loved his lectures and had a blast learning by watching his videos, which are well-made, too. You do need to take a lot of notes, though, and his exams can be very tough. Other than that, he's an amazing teacher who explains his concepts really well! His love for fish makes my heart very happy, too!

This man & his love of fish! Such a gem. No prof puts this much effort into their lectures. While content was often boring, but he did everything he could to make it fun and he is so passionate! The exams were hard, study like they are closed book. He also gave everyone 3/4 bonus on exams to account for "marking error".

Although Chapleau explained the concepts well, the lectures were extremely boring and I did not enjoy much of the content. The thing that I am most bothered by is the fact that he wants specific key words on his exams. They were extremely difficult and he is a very picky grader. Points will be taken off if u ask for a remark.
Online He is one of the best, I really missed his lecture I loved the way he take about natures, I encourage you to take this prof he is amazing ��, but you need to take a lot of notes in his classes

*online* His lectures were long but very informative and entertaining! He's a good prof, interesting content and always links his explanations to personal experience. That being said, WRITE DOWN LITERALLY EVERYTHING HE SAYS as his exams consist of very specific questions about random stuff.

Very passionate teacher that gives interesting lectures. The only downfall with him is the exams and the grading, and it is a very big downfall. His exams expectations are ridiculous. You need to use specific key words and will not get points if not used specific points. His multiple choice don't test your knowledge but how easily he can trick you.

His lectures were always very engaging, and he's clearly passionate about what he teaches, but I often found that the material lacked cohesiveness. It was also always tough to tell what was important and what was not. Exam questions are pulled from the fine details of his lectures, so be careful of that.

I took this class online. His lectures are so long winded. There were very few assignments so it was difficult to stay on track. He's such a picky grader that even if you explain something correctly but don't use a specific term you won't get the marks. He has some inspiring moments but mostly boring.

He can teach there's no doubt about that; however, very picky on tests & exams. Make sure you know key words & really expand & make connections (some things on grading rubrics which we got after I didn't even know were apart of the answer). So be very careful, but amazing lectures & easy to understand.

For taking this course online, the asynchronous lectures were extremely tedious even though they were at times really interesting. He often went over the allotted lecture time, which was pretty inconvenient, but great lectures!

his lectures (videos) are enjoyable, you really learn A LOT of interesting things... however, as i said it is A LOT of information. the time he gives for midterms is not sufficient . and everyone was complaining about the grading... it is awful ...

one word: AMAZING very caring and teaches the material in a very easy to understand way. replies to emails very quickly and really care about his students' success. make sure you watch ALL THE LECTURES. this is where all exam/midterm questions come from!!

He's very passionate about what he teaches which makes lectures more interesting. He also gives out bonus points which makes a big difference in your final grade! Great guy, would definitely recommend him as a prof.

Cares about success of students. Lectures were youtube vids so it was easy to pause and go back whenever I wanted. He used a green screen so the videos consisted of the power points and him on the side explaining and pointing to things which was more engaging than the audio recordings of other profs. Could have worded questions on the exams better

Despite lacking of clarity while explaining certain ideas, his lectures are generally good. However, I really hate the way, which is impersonal and harsh, he evaluates midterms and final. His multiple choice questions are often very tricky, and no part marks are given for short answer. I think it's unfair for those who studied very hard.
hes a good teacher but his grading is sooo tough, I left the final thinking i did great and ended up with a 49%

I really liked him at first. Even by the end, I still did to some extent, but I thought his exams were marked too harshly. They require really careful attention to detail, and if you missed the key words, you would get 0 regardless whether you answered the questions correctly or not. Lectures are very long, but interesting. You have to study HARD.

His midterms were rushed he then compensated for this by just making the final worth more if you did better on it. Assessments were very specific to his examples, even though a lot of his examples did not fit in with what his lectures were talking about. No resources at all to study for his class, so memorize his examples and hope for the best.

He likes evolution too much. His midterm question are very specific to the examples he gives. He likes questions were the answer is none of the above so you do have to know your stuff. No homework or practice questions. Textbook is not necessary since everything he says is what comes on the midterm. Go to office hour if you have questions. Doable.

Really important to watch all the videos and take concise notes as you will be tested on stuff he says during his lectures and MC are detail-oriented. Make sure to review keywords as the long answers are marked solely off certain words/concepts being stated. Midterms/exams are open book but you DEFINITELY need to study for them because of timing.

MUST attend class and write down EVERYTHING he says because it shows up on the midterm. His tests are kind of long, so you have to understand the material, even if it is open notes (you'll fail otherwise). For his class, don't memorize, rather understand all of the examples he gives you, and USE THE KEY WORDS IN LONG ANSWER Q'S(otherwise no points)

Exam was easier than the midterms. Watch lectures as they come out or else you will die, take good notes, and summarize info with a friend. This is the key to success. Email him if you have questions and make sure u understand everything. The midterm is super specific!! Make sure you hit all key words for long answer. Not impossible, but work hard!

Chapleau was by far the best prof I had this semester. His lectures were pretty fun and you really don't need the textbook because all of the midterm and exam content was based on what he said in class. It's best to take notes of every little thing he says in the lectures because his multiple-choice questions are pretty hard and very specific.

I got an A+ (almost 100% actually, lol) in the course but it was NOT easy. It sucks that you cannot avoid this monster. His lectures are extremely time-consuming. On midterm 2, he gave us 1 minute per MCQ even though it took 1 whole minute just to read the paragraph-length question. Good luck - you'll need it.

Honestly, the asynchronous videos ain't it. It ends up being a case of rewinding clips multiple times because the prof talked too fast or mumbled something that could've been important. The class has a lot of content and the tests refer to specific examples so your notes have to be detailed. There are no practice tests or questions; makes prep hard

Out of all the profs I had this semester, Chapleau handled the switch to online the best. Tests were open book. The time was tight - so you had to study and know your stuff to not be flipping through your notes wasting time. But that's completely fair! He put so much extra effort into his lectures. Real gem. Take good, detailed notes and you're set

Il est évident que Professeur Chapleau est très passionné de sa matière. Bien que le cours était en ligne, il a travaillé avec l'équipe BIO1530 afin de produire des cours captivants et fluides. Je dirais que le cours comprend beaucoup de contenu, et il n'y a pas beaucoup d'opportunités de pratiquer avant l'examen.

I'm not gonna lie, I'm in my fourth year and this course kicked my butt lol but I feel like first year courses are designed to be tough. Overall, I think Prof Chapleau was fair and it's a good introduction to the other bio courses to come in terms of course load/grading. He's definitely very passionate about biology!

The class content is very interesting but the evaluations are not reasonable. He didn't get enough time and you need to use the exact key word or you get 0 point (i feel like TA don't read you examen, they look for key word), He made very hard cause it's online, and that not a reasonable reason. AND he signed the nword petitions:(

Cleary very passionate about biology, but mostly fish. Examples he talks about are very important - make sure to take plenty of notes during lectures. He is very good at explaining concepts and making them interesting & applicable. Exams are tough but clear and fair.

Chapleau is a really good lecturer and yes you need to take notes on what he says and not just rely on the ppts. MC can be pretty tricky so read CAREFULLY. I see people complaining abt "key words" for short ans, but those words are vital to the answer?? like if you arent including them what are u doing? Too bad he supports the petition tho

He is one of the worst prof I've had. He has so much content that he covers and he also adds a lot of his bs that he tests us on. You have to take notes on what he says bc if you rely on the power points, you will fail. His tests are really hard and the amount of time he gives is very little. If you dont have to, dont take the course.

He assumed that overnight students are fast typers, and have adapted to e-learning! we had to be able to do online tests and all our years of learning it was on paper. That is why the time for exams was unfair. On top of all that, he made the exams extra hard cause it is online. I wish he monitored like others did. Also, he is not approachable...
I am getting an A+ in MAT1330, CHM1311, ANP1105, and ENG1320 before the final exam. For this sh*t, I am getting a 60s. I think this is enough to show how suck this prof is.

Professor Chapleau did a great job transitioning to online learning! He posted video lectures that were thorough and engaging and it really helped to keep the class interesting. His tests were hard but fair. The course is content-heavy but he is very clear about what is expected and if you study enough you'll be just fine!

The class content is intresting and the videos are well prepared but the evaluations are not reasonable because of the ridiculus time he gives. I think he made his evaluations very hard cause it's online . You have to put key word in your answers cause I feel like TA's did command find to correct and didn't read the answers.

A very hard course, and professor Chapleau makes it way harder. He is very unfair with marking, very unfair with time given for each midterm and his lectures are so heavy. This course is the worst course.

The people who are doing science and think he has way too many details in his lectures should probably rethink their degree. This is ORGANISMAL BIO. Of course there are details. His lectures and examples are very interesting and while time consuming to get through, don't get boring. The best first year prof by far. If you have him, be happy!

I don't understand the people saying he is monotonous. I have never met a professor who is so animated in gestures and vocal tone as Dr. Chapleau. Sure, there is a lot of content in each lecture, but I was never bored. Rather than simply lecturing, he turns everything into a story, which I found really helpful and easier to memorize than facts.
The content we have to memorize for midterm, final is ridiculous

I love the passion that oozed from his soul. He loves fish. Pescatarians will love this class, because he loves fish, and so do you. He wants us to save the fish. Fish 4 life. Seriously he is fun to listen to and he obviously is a great prof, but his exams are tricky and hard. Just like trying to catch a fish.

Chapleau was one of the better profs I had this semester. He knows his stuff and explains concepts clearly, however, his lectures are quite long and content heavy. Make sure you write down everything he says, as most of the material on his midterms had to do with specific examples he talked about in class. Overall, solid prof.

Chapleau refuses to give students practice questions for the exams, which makes the already very hard exams even harder to get a good grade. He takes forever to respond to emails. And his exams are really long, and he gives barely any time to write answers on par with his expectations. However, his vids are organized, i'll give him that much.

The professor knows his stuff and knows how to teach. The TA's however only care about specific words when grading and not fundamental understanding, and the tests themselves are very unfair with multiple-choice considering you have 1 minute to read and answer each. It is also hard to study as there isn't really any outside practise you can do.

He has a very monotone voice, which made it hard to pay attention and stay focused. His lectures were really long and he talked about fish A LOT. Not a bad teacher and goes over the important material really well and uses good examples that make sense, but doesn't give nearly enough time on the tests.

This is a very difficult class. Not enough time for tests, only about 1min per multiple choice question. You need to have keywords in your long answers to get marks. Course is interesting but very content heavy, almost all marks come from tests so its very hard to do well. You could have great understanding of the material and still fail.

Francois Chapleau made handling the online semester seem like something he was born to do. He made some of the most interesting and captivating powerpoints I have ever seen from a teacher, which in turn made his lectures very easy to follow. He also provided a very reasonable workload, and kept good communication with us throughout the semester.

The lectures were asynchronous videos. Did not do well on the midterms because you have very little time, so make sure you study. Midterms are also marked hard. There are multiple-choice and long answer. The long answers need keywords to get the marks, but we are not given the words prior to the exam.
Pretty sad that there's not an option for another for this class.
BEST PROF EVER

he gives hardly enough time for midterms because i think he thinks that "open book"  students are speed readers and typers... grading is unclear and keyword based. Didn't use the exact word in the rubric? 0/5. u never know what the keywords r until after and the lectures are boring and disorganized...d

Chapleau is very unaccommodating when it comes to online teaching. Throughout this course, he released the lectures as asynchronous videos, so you basically have to teach yourself the entire course content. Chapleau doesn't give any extra practice materials, so if you're hoping to have access to past midterms or exams - don't count on it. GOODLUCK

Chapleau knows his stuff, i'm not denying that. However, his exams are very long and the grading is harsh. We barely have anytime to think or write our answers on the exams, and then we get penalized for it. The stuff we have to learn for the exam is insane. He gives out no practice questions and also refuses to tell us the details of his tests.

Every class is an Infodump, but Chapleau gives a lot of examples that tie into his personal life or with the area around uOttawa. Professor Chapleau is adorable and passionate. The only thing is the mark scheme is very picky about wording. Unfortunately he signed the petition supporting the prof who said the n word in class, so he's problematic.

Half of these 5 star ratings are just mindless praises, atleast offer some useful advice. Chapleau can teach, he provides lots of visuals backed by explanations. Make sure to take note of his examples as you will be tested on them. Test questions are very specific and descriptive, so study your terms. Short answers are very strict on terminology.

The final is over 415 slides and he expect us to memorize every single details on what he said during the class. It's over 20 hours of videos that we need to memorize. 1 mins per MCQ isn't enough time. If your answer doesn't have the keyword you're gonna get 0 regardless if the answer is good.

I found that this course is not easy at all. Chapleaus midterms are very difficult and tricky. Got no help whatsoever to help boost our grades in this class (no assignments, only 2 quizzes. 2 midterms). Material is very heavy and lectures are very long too. In spite of all that, he knows how to teach and convey the idea well.
Prof Chap made the material very interesting and his videos were very enjoyable to watch. But you gotta really study for his midterms and know the material well, cause he likes to throw trick Q's.

He's so passionate about what he teaches which is really nice, however, his voice is so soothing it's hard to pay attention especially when he talks about bacteria or phytoplankton. His tests are very hard, especially the multiple-choice questions that are extremely tricky and his graders for the written questions are extremely unfair. Good prof.

Great guy, very knowledgeable, teaches well with many examples. His online lectures consist of pausing and rewinding every minute to write down everything he says. You can study for days and still get a bad mark on exams because the TA's mark horribly (they look for key words rather than proof of understanding). MC are tough. But he gives bonus:)

Great prof. 2nd midterm was harder than 1st, but both were fair. Lectures are interesting but he talks really fast, so you have to pause the video every 2 milliseconds to write down what he says. A lot of the specific things he says are on the exams too, so be aware of that. Your hand will have a cramp by the end of each lecture!

His online lectures are pretty interesting and this prof clearly makes an effort for his students. Only bad thing is the amount of content is insane. Be ready to write notes non-stop during every lecture.
MCQ are precise.
Great teacher but makes you work hard
The best first year prof. His enthusiasm for biology is infectious!

Dr. Chapleau is amazing. His lectures are very interesting, although they take a while to get through. Beware though, he talks very fast! All of the exam questions are based on the lecture content, and they are very fair. He gives you opportunities to improve your grades, and on top of everything, his voice is so soothing to listen to!
He seems great at first, but he is unprofessional. All I will say is that he teaches without thinking about his students needs and its sad. He's on Twitter.

get ready for a prof that talks at a speed of 100000 miles an hour, forcing you to rewind his prerecorded videos 10 times every 2 seconds so that you can actually catch what he said. it's absolutely horrendous and i want to die.
the best prof ever, although this is my first semester I love his teaching method and how he brings te example

So hes a genuinely good teacher and understands the matter at hand extremely well. Although he goes off on tangents sometimes that kind of lose me. So far every course has had a mini discussion about false religion which I dont think fits into the course very well.

Where to start? This man is like the new generation Bob Ross... such a soothing voice! But don't fall asleep, he has everything you need in the slideshows, and you might miss some stuff. Online was fantastic, such interactive Powerpoints and he's always there to answer an email or comment. Love the guy!

Chapleau is passionate about the subject and pretty funny. Attendance is mandatory, he grades on what he says in class so write down literally everything he says. If you study well you should do fine, but those multiple choice questions WILL get you. He did take off a few MC questions after more than half the class got it wrong so he does care.

Prof Chapleau was extremely passionate about the course material, and he also had a good sense of humour. The two midterms and final exam is fair if you study for them (and you only really need to study from the slides, not the textbook). However, I don't recommend taking this class at 8:30am.

He's clearly passionate about the class. Explains concepts clearly. Provides lots of examples in slides and some in class which are not explicit in notes. Midterms ad exams based on content of the class. The questions are not difficult (except for tricky mcqs). The difficulty is being able to answer all questions and properly within the time limit.
Honestly the best first year prof ever. His classes are super interesting, and his obsession with fish is adorable

Chapleau is great but make sure to listen VERY CAREFULLY and literally write down very specifically. He asks things so specifically. Don't even buy the textbook he tests you on what he says in class. So you only need to go to class. tbh I only listened to his podcast because I found it more efficient. Up to you tho. But overall great.
Easy class but have to work for it. He's amazing at teaching and available outside of class. Also he's a very good speaker.

He's very passionate about what he teaches. He brings a lot of personal research into his class which helps with understanding the material and concepts. For the tests, read the questions carefully, they're usually traps!

Chapleau is one of my favourite professors I had first year. He gives really good lectures, and also posts podcasts for you to listen to after class (I still recommend going to class for a good grade). His multiple choice is specific, but if you put in the effort, getting an A is really easy!
Amazing teacher, very passionate and really interesting. Tested on the small things he says during lecture. Pay attention in lectures, study mainly off your notes and you'll do great!

My favourite prof at uottawa by far. The man bell curves every single exam in order to give people a fair mark as he understands that markers can be tough. Hated the course so much but he made it very interesting. No textbook required. Second midterm very tough but final was the easiest. Good luck, try hard and you are guaranteed a good mark.

THE BEST PROF AT UOTTAWA HANDS DOWN! He is VERY clear on what he wants you to know! he wants you to understand the main concept and not necessarily the details. Make sure you listen to the podcasts at least once because literally everything he says is important. He gives good hints in class so pay attention. Put in the effort and you will get an A+

Chapleau is a vey knowledgeable in the subject matter taught and reflects that very well. However I found sometimes he could go rambling on and I would lose the main idea he was trying to get across. Labs are free points that should be taken advantage of. On his midterms get ready to see lots of none of the above and they were very hard, covers all

Chapleau is a great prof! He explains things very well during the lecture, shows videos, live demonstrations, and many examples to ensure his students understand the concepts. You do not need a textbook for this course, his midterms and exams are all based on what he says in class. He posts podcasts of every lecture, so if you miss a class, its ok!
Lectures are interesting but you need to memorize absolutely everything to stand a chance at answering every question on the exams.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Dr. Chapleau was my favourite prof this semester. He's clearly very passionate about biology which makes his lectures very interesting. His exams (specifically the multiple choice section) are difficult, so don't procrastinate studying. Make sure you study and memorize ALL of the examples he gives in class. Would definitely recommend!

Very good lectures and podcasts for his lectures are posted on the bright space. Unfortunately, the ta's who mark all the midterms grade solely based on specific vocabulary words in your responses. So understanding the concepts is worth nothing without the specific terms. His multiple choice are also extremely specific and are based on things said.

such an AMAZING prof. Although the course is content heavy and sometimes super hard to stay awake in class, he taught so well. Even just going to class and listening without taking notes helps for midterms/exam. He is so extremely fair at marking and gives extra points. Go to class if you really want to do good. All his lectures are recorded as wel

His French accent can be a bit hard to understand but his lectures are very thorough :) if you just go to class and review your notes, its an easy A! (if you listen closely during his lectures he gives clues about what will be on the short/long answer part of tests) only hard thing are his multiple choice q's but he gives out bonus marks

Really good prof, GO TO CLASS and write down EVERY exemple! he'll even tell u this at the beginning of classes cause a lot of his midterms is about what he says in class. He wants very specific answers for his long answer questions cause he looks for key words in ur answers, so without a certain word, u dont get a point! Have fun :)
He's a sweet guy! Professor Chapleau is very approachable and friendly. Make sure you pay attention to what he says during class because that's 10000% more important than what's on the slides.

A really great prof. Would recommend going to class and taking notes on his examples. He only tests you on what you learn in class and it is mainly concept based. Relistening to the lectures helps learn his examples as he posts the audio on Brightspace. Only issue is that the TAs aren't great markers but he gives out bonus marks to make up for it:)

This man is an absolute gem. His lectures are interesting and he is very intelligent in his field. His exams are mostly concept based and about what he says in class. Make sure you study mostly the examples given in class rather than the specifics.

Chapleau is a good prof, the only problem is his midterms can get sneaky, especially with the multiple choice. He also has a lot of examples on the midterm that he explains in class, so you need to either go to the lectures or listen to his podcasts.
Chapleau is the best prof I had during first year.

get ready for "NONE OF THE ABOVE" multiple choices, most annoying stuff ever, but he's really nice that he records lectures in english and french and posts slides online, and will tell you exam content and structure a week in advance
very cool professor i fell in love with fishes because of him would take again 10/10

THE BEST PROF EVER. IM NOT EXAGGERATING. Dr. Chapleau made the lessons throughout the semester into this seamless story that kept his students clinging to his every word. Every class was so incredibly interesting. His midterms and exam had no surprises (they were actually fun to write). Attend class, take good notes! BEST. PROF. EVER. Enough said.

Every single word that came out of this mans' mouth was gold. He was never boring, I ALWAYS listened in lectures because I never felt like I was learning. It truly felt like I was listening to someone tell me a story about evolution. His exam was amazing, I literally ENJOYEd doing the exam which I don't think a lot of people like doing.

Absolutely AMAZING prof! His lectures are detailed and interesting; you can tell that he is really passionate about his field. He voice records and posts his lectures online, which makes reviewing for exams a lot easier. Exam questions are often scenarios that we have gone over in class. All you need to do to pass is pay attention and study.

This guy is SO sweet, cares about you and his field, excellent teacher, goes over everything thoroughly & properly. He can lose himself talking about fish sometimes but listen closely cause most times the examples & side notes are on the exams.
Amazing
really interesting teeacher, really passionate about biology. Love him a lot

A real gem. His marking was definitely fair and he gave bonus marks to everyone to account for possible TA marking errors that boosted each evaluation by about 5%. Passionate about his fish and makes the course content really interesting. Speaks at a good pace and is easy to understand. Also loved the discussions we had about science and religion.

Chapleau is an amazing professor. He's accessible, he really goes into the detail with each concept and he goes over the exams afterwards which I think is great. His exams are fair, but not easy. However, he gives bonus points on all his exams which kinda compensates. I found the second exam was the hardest and the final the easiest honestly.
funniest man i have ever met, literally not one bad thing to say. a million good things. uottawa should feel lucky that he graces this institution. love love love francois

Great lecturer, providing very detailed examples to help with understanding. Generally a difficult first year course b/c tests are heavy on short answer questions and his grading criteria are VERY specific. You have to take good notes and make sure you thoroughly understand all big examples enough to be able to write about their specific details

He's an amazing prof! Lectures were interesting and you could tell that he is passionate about biology (especially fish). Study everything that is on the slides and everything he says, including examples. Final exam was a breeze, but was VERY content heavy; we had to know all 18 chapters seen over the semester. Definitely NOT a bird course!
Best bio prof in the world :)

I LOVE CHAPLEAU!! I am in Biology, and taking his class made me love the subject even more. The second midterm was super hard, though the final was a lot easier than what I was expecting. He is a great guy. Take notes in class, because what he says is just as important as whats on the slides.

A well known LEGEND. Not many people dislike going to his class! He is VERY intelligent and can answer any biological type question. In addition, Chapleau has an amazing sense of humour and is very fair, so be prepared for a good time! One noteworthy detail is that the second midterm is much harder than the first so don't get too comfortable!
Great prof
Make sure to take notes during the lectures.

Show up to every lecture and take detailed notes. Use a laptop! All the plebs with notebooks won't be able to catch up with this G of a prof. Pay attention, he literally tells you what examples are important and they WILL show on the exam. Don't bother with a textbook, just know his lecture notes AND what he says are crucial to pass.

Chapleau is a great guy who makes the class interesting and engaging. Take detailed notes of the examples he goes over in class because they WILL be on the midterms and exams. Not a bird course but you are guaranteed a good mark if you make the effort and attend the lectures.

Chapleau is an amazing prof! He makes lectures engaging and interesting and it is clear that he cares about his students. If you go to class, pay attention, and take careful notes of what he says, you are guaranteed to do well. Highly recommend taking a class with him throughout your time at the university.

Great guy, very french, who loves fish. Don't buy the textbook, I never opened it. Labs are a joke so easy mark boosters. His midterms/exam are multiple choice + short and long answer questions. He gives trick questions so read carefully! Lots to memorize, so study in advance, it's not a class you can cram for (from someone who tends to cram...).
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Accessible outside class', 'Test heavy']

rComments: This class is difficult because the only thing contributing to your marks are the midterms, final, and lab. The midterms are more difficult than the final. He expects you to anticipate what questions he is going to ask on the midterms, but AT NO POINT during the semester did he hint at what questions could be.

A man with a voice more soothing than Bob Ross. A blessing? You might ask. But beware, for it is so easy to be trapped under the spell of that majestic tone and fall asleep, only to find yourself waking up at the end of lecture - disappointed of yourself, for missing out that comforting vocal. But wait! There's a podcast online, an ASMR unmatched o

Easily best prof I've ever had. No need for textbook, slides and notes are sufficient. With that being said, you need to show up to lectures and take down notes. Examples he spends most time on ARE going to be on the tests. His podcasts are a great way to prepare for tests.

HIs lectures are a lot of fun. The issue is that the tests are harder than you think. He gives a lot of free marks so it makes up for it. Overall great guy, not exactly a bird course for a science credit if that is what you are thinking.
He's great

Best Professor in University, very passionate about what he teaches!!! If you put the effort you can easily get an A+. Listen to his podcasts and write everything he says. A lot of time and energy but definitely worth it!

Hands down the best educator I have ever had. My schedule never worked with his office hours but he always made time to see me. He is passionate (especially about fish) and it really makes the class an enjoyable experience. Do NOT take this man for granted--he cares so greatly for all his students&looked so happy at the exam, smiling at everyone:)

Chapleau is a prof that goes above and beyond for students. You can tell he is passionate about the material and wants you to learn. He is always cracking jokes and makes lectures easy to understand and enjoyable. The lectures are all recorded so you can skip every class and get an A+. He also gives bonus marks on every midterm and the final!

Chapleau is one of the best profs at uOttawa! His lectures are engaging and his exam questions are taken straight from his slides, which he posts online (he will even tell you exactly which slides to study from for each midterm). If you go to class and take decent notes, you can easily get an A+. He also boosts the class 5-10% for each midterm.

Dr Chapleau is an amazing professor, he is very passionate about his field and his lectures are very interesting. He is well respected and always around to give you feedback and help you succeed. He is very devoted to his students and is hands down an amazing teacher, I highly recommend him if you're looking for a biology prof.

Make you sure attend class and take notes since that is mainly what the exams are based off on. The TAs mark the exams pretty hard, so make sure to be specific in your answers. He is a really nice teacher and he also LOVES talking about fishes.
Make sure to attend class and take good notes. Exams are mostly based off of lecture notes. Great prof, and the lectures are very interesting and packed with information.

Lectures were great at beginning of semester, got a little boring towards the end. Overall, awesome guy. Reuses questions from old midterms. Multiple choice questions were weirdly worded, long answer questions were weirdly graded. No homework, and relatively information light. Annoying testing, average course, great prof.

The marking scheme in this class is very unclear, as many students had marks deducted for no reason, while their answer was clearly indicated. The first midterm includes the least amount of material; however, the final exam includes an unreasonable amount of material to learn.

Chapleau is very enthusiastic about the course (and fish). He is very testy during office hours, and offers little sympathy for egregious mistakes made by his TAs in marking. He does record lectures, but the best thing about him, is that he gives a 5-10% bonus on the exams to "compensate" for errors. The final is very content-heavy
-Makes you work for an A+ but is completely possible. You must understand most of the concepts and know how to apply them, and obviously memorize as well

Honestly the best prof. He's very thorough during lectures and adds info that isn't on the slides so it's important to attend lectures. Very clear on what he wants you to know for the midterms and final. Textbook is recommended as a resource but not required. Obviously wants his students to succeed. Also very passionate about fish.

He is a great professor in my opinion. I did not attend the majority of lectures, which was a mistake on my part as he provides a lot of info from his lectures alone. The good thing is that he records all of his lectures, and posts them online. The only marks you receive are from midterms, labs and finals.

François Chapleau is an amazing prof, the class is very content heavy but if you keep on top of your studying and give yourself enough time to study you should do just fine! His exams are pretty difficult and the multiple choices are tricky with little details. He somehow makes the class interesting.

The best biology teacher in this whole damn university. Bottom line, you wanna pass with bio 1130 and find a love for biology, take this course with Dr. Chapleau. The feedbacks are great, the exams are easy of you prepare and TAKE GOOD NOTES IN CLASS. P.S - you gonna learn a lot about fishes ��

Chapleau is a really passionate guy. His lectures are quite interesting and he really cares for the subject of biology. He does hint at possible test questions. Having said that, I found his tests to be extremely hard; especially his multiple choice. He posts podcasts of all his lectures giving you leeway to miss class. Fair, but tough course...

Best professor I've had this year, even though I didn't really like biology. You could tell he cared about his subject matter and his students doing well. I went to talk to him for help with exam preparation at it was incredibly helpful. I suggest going early in the year to talk too I'm about what he wants on midterms / study notes.

He is a really good teacher but all of his tests/midterms are based on the stuff done in class, not the powerpoints. you have to go to class to be able to pass the midterms/final because he gives examples that are not on powerpoint. Gives bonus marks which helps if you do not do very well. do not buy the textbook was not any help/did not use

I really enjoyed his class! All the lectures are recorded and posted online along with the powerpoint used in class (attend class anyways). I didn't use the textbook at all. His class notes and lectures is all you need to succeed. He also add 5% -10% on to each exam grade to cancel out possible marking errors by TAs. He often talks about fish...

This professor actually cares about teaching and wants you to get something out of his lectures. You have to actually attend class because the professor tests not only on powerpoint material but spoken material as well. A good guy overall though.

Chapleau is one of the best profs at uOttawa. He cares about his students and wants them to succeed (he curves too!) He keeps lectures interesting with videos and demos and is passionate about what he teaches (ESPECIALLY fish). Go to class or listen to the podcasts, his examples WILL be on the exams. Honestly, 11/10 recommend this course with him.

He is an awesome professor! Super engaging, and very approachable. His midterms/exams are totally based off his lectures, so if you go to class then they will be very easy to study for. Would definitely recommend!
C'est le meilleur prof que tu peux avoir en 1ere année

This prof is absolutely amazing. I realized how amazing he was when I was studying for the second midterm and I realized that I had retained 90% of the content he taught in the lectures. Of course I had listened to his podcasts but I only had to listen to them once. His slides and examples are very clear and memorable.

Makes lectures interesting with his amazing sense of humor and examples (his examples will be on the exams so make sure to go to class or get these examples from friends). Also gives hints about content of exams and seems like a really fair guy overall who actually wants his students to succeed.

His lectures are more entertaining than television. Hes very funny and you can really see the passion he has for what he teaches (especially when its about fish). The only thing to be aware of is that he goes on on interesting tangents that will be on the exam. He barely wastes time with the lectures. He also posts them which is awesome.I love him
Best professor I've had so far, the guy literally got a standing ovation at the end. Also probably the easiest course I took so far. I RECOMMEND this guy is a real 10/10

So sweet and funny! Transitioning from high school to univesity science is hard, and he's the first uni prof to actually give the class study tips and advice. Take good notes in class, and use those key words on exams (lots of memorizing). Very caring and wants all his students to succeed. No assignments, just midterms.

Chapleau is my favourite prof in university. He is so kind and super into animal biology which is funny. He has so many weird stories about his field experience as a biologist but honestly thats what makes him so likeable. Also records his audio from his lectures which is so amazing come test time. He wants you to do well which is unique here..

Amazing prof, interesting class. You don't really need the textbook, other than for further explanations in the event that you missed something in class. Absolutely cannot skip class, what is on the pptx is not sufficient. The key words are super important for the midterms and the final.
only bio prof so far that made bio enjoyable! he's just the sweetest man and is sooo knowledgeable. This class is an easy A if you go back and listen to his podcasts word for word

CHAPLEAU IS A BABEEE, super fun lectures, he is very clear about what will be on the exams and the course is pretty easy if you study a bit or read the textbook. Super interesting cause he uses his real life experiences with biology to teach

AMAZING prof!! Made the topic a lot more enjoyable and is truly passionate about what he teaches. Midterms and final are based on lectures - he posts podcasts and powerpoints so take thorough notes to do well in his course! Is very funny, caring, and is easily accessible outside class. Would definitely take him again!

Chapleau is such a sweet and quirky man! I loved coming to his class and listening to all of his stories. His tests were fair, and he told us what to expect on them. You can tell he is passionate about the subject, and he was happy to answer questions outside of class. He made first semester really enjoyable for me!
My favorite class first year! Chapleau often brought weird specimens along in his bag to show the class and made his lectures as interesting as possible. Would take another class with him any day!

Great prof who loves fish and makes his lectures very interesting. Also, his exams were very fair. Pretty much everything that he says during the lecture will be on the exam (or at least whatever he spends the most time on). No tricks and very straight forward marking scheme and he sometimes adds an extra 10% to your exam grade. Highly recommended!

Chapleau is great! His classes are very interesting and his passion for the subject is clearly evident. Gives lots of bonus marks as well. Only negative is that this was his first time teaching the english course and some test questions were unclear and not all material was conveyed as effectively as it could have been.

If you love anatomy with a passion, this class is for you. Very heavy as an elective, but very interesting course material. There's a 3 hour lab per week - if you want to succeed the lab exams with a good grade, extra time spent in the lab is required. All the tests were fair, but don't underestimate them. EXCELLENT, honest and caring professor.

Great prof! he's eccentric (weird yet funny love for fishes) and passionate about what he teaches. Lectures were never boring for me. The class of BIO1530 is kinda heavy but he recordes podcasts and is always available. Get ready to read though and make sure you understand the theory, if so you can pass with a great mark!
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Please please please appreciate this professor and enjoy his class because that is the only happiness you will get before you have to face the devil of Petit-Turcotte in BIO1140. He is an amazing professor and knows how to teach biology the right way. Truly loved his class.

You don't need to attend class, but you will want to! He makes every class very interesting... material only gets boring near the final. He makes learning easy! He records lectures. It's an easy pass and he is a sweet guy. The grade you get depends on your TA for the midterms. Final was an easy pass!
Amazing prof. He's very caring and gives out so many hints about what to look out for on the exams. Exam content is based on what he says in class so make sure you listen to all his lectures.

This was a very interesting class and a very interesting professor. Beware though, many things that are said in class ae vital in the exams and he doesn't tend to refer to the textbook. Loved his lecturing and loved the fish!

Loves fish- will tell you about his studies, and he relates it to the material which is super great! Makes podcasts of his lectures, but still, GO TO CLASS. Exams are based entirely on what he says in lecture, the textbook is supplementary.

This prof is actually too blessed. Literally curves every exam (we got a 10% boost when the class avg was already higher than other courses). I honestly don't know how you can take this class with Chapleau and not get at least a 98.

By far one of the best bio prof I've had! His exams are reasonable if you study well in advance, and he takes them up in class too. He usually says more than what's on the slide shows, so anything he says is far game for the exams. With that being said, quite a few of his questions on the exams are from examples he talks about in class.

Un des meilleurs professeurs que j'ai eu de tout mon bac. Passionné par son sujet et super bon enseignant! Il faut absolument aller au cours car 50% de son examen est sur ce qu'il DIT et DÉMONTRE en classe. Réécouter les balados des cours aide ÉNORMÉMENT pour l'étude.

Hands down best prof. He loves fish and is a total dork about it. Super chill and his lectures were just so fascinating. If you love animals and evolution, you'll love this class. Exams were easy and he even gives a bonus for "TA errors". Gave a 7% bonus to everyone for the final. Real gem.

Great prof, but don't be fooled by the fact that he records the audio to his lectures; go to class. A lot of the material on exams isn't on the powerpoints, you have to be there to get the link between the powerpoint and what he's saying.

Best prof I've had so far at uOttawa. Excellent lectures and very fair midterms. Posts everything on BrightSpace (including videos) and is super accessible outside of class. Highly recommend using his podcasts to study and not just the slides.
Absolute legend of a prof. Crown jewel of the bio department. To all first years, enjoy what biology really is all about with him while you can; 1140 with turcotte will just be brutal.

I absolutely recommend this professor. Hes the best. Two midterms and a final. The MC is a bit tough, but if you study youll do well. Be consise in your written answers. Doesnt use textbook; records lectures; clear in his expectations. If you want to succeed, write down good notes during the lectures, and just study those. Hes so awesome!

Professor Chapleau is fantastic professor especially for a first year class like biology. He explains everything really well and adds many real world examples to make sure everyone gets the concepts. Studying is super important in this class along with taking your own notes of what he says because he usually tests on that and his notes.
Very fluffy human. Go talk to him if he can because he will make your life much easier through his explanation. His podcasts are super useful and his slideshows give you everything you need.

Engaging and interesting prof. Midterms are a bit tricky as the TAs who mark exclusively look for keywords, but he tries to compensate by giving some boosts. The exam was ridiculously easy and he even gave boosts on that. I recommend this prof greatly, as he really does care for the success of students.
very good and fair prof. cares about his students, however it is very difficult to score good marks on the midterms/exams as the ta's are difficult to please. highly recommend.

A very boring subject which is more of a personal qualm than anything against the prof. Very engaging and interesting lectures though it does all seem to eventually dissolve into memorizing tons of definitions and events before the mid terms and final

This prof is amaazing! For every concept he teaches, he provides many cool examples! This man is so knowledgable about this course and FISH. He made me fall in love with this class. His exams are fair and only tests you on things he says in class. The key to an A+ is so listen to his podcasts word for word because he requires specific responses.
His class is impossible until you figure out how cruel the correction is

Im halfway through 3rd year, and still looking back at how amazing his lectures were. In first semester of first year, I took his teaching style for granted. Its only after that I realized how much of a gem he is.

An incredible prof who is very genuine and happy to teach. Lectures contain examples that aren't in the slides that will appear on midterms and exams so attend lecture! The material is reminiscent of high school biology so it's not too difficult but there's a large volume of material to study.
He gave a lot of extra extra points especially for Hardy Weinberg modules. Great guy; TAKE NOTES IN CLASS! super accessible

Amazing! He is passionate about what he teaches which motivates students to pay attention. Rarely used the textbook; most of the test content was based on what was taught during class. A lot of the information is not on the PPTS (slides are very general) so listen well & take really good notes. Actually enjoyed his lectures. Highly recommend!

Best professor I've ever had. The course is pretty fair, expectations are clear, and the content associated with the course can be hilarious. Pay attention during lectures and take notes and you'll be perfectly suited for the exams. Bonus: You'll learn to love flatfish.

One of the best lecturers I've ever heard, easily captivates the audience and the only class this semester I felt compelled to attend, that being said he posts all slides and audio of him talking online so its really not necessary. This man loves fish and its hilarious. Tests are marked on the harder side.

Very good teacher, his classes are always interesting and he has such a passion for the course and material he covers. Some lectures can be boring depending on the material but most of the year you will find yourself engaged with what he says. DO attend class if you want to do good on the exam and do take good notes. Midterm marking is precise

Bring coffee to his morning classes... I ended up sleeping in half of them because of the lights are dimmed and he has a VERY soothing voice. Great prof though, he has fair exams and adds bonus marks. Study, understand the concepts and be able to explain them with his examples. TAKE GOOD NOTES

BEST BIO CLASS BY FAR, the prof is just amazing. Wants student to do well and provides all knowledge and tools to do so. Gives easy to understand examples and exams are super super fair (unlike bio 1140) Makes 830 classes so much fun, you will not regret taking this course
Really great prof, he is passionate about what he teaches (especially anything involving fish) and he got a big round of applause after every lecture. Would recommend.
Really great prof. Exams are tough but offers bonus marks for possible marker errors. Loves his fish too!

Huge fish guy, loves his fish. All around good prof, makes you care about what he's saying. Exams aren't easy, but he gives a 5% mark boost for "possible marking error and variance in TA marking". I'd take one of his classes again.

Chapleau is hands down the best prof out there. His lectures are amazing because he's passionate about what he's teaching. Taking good notes is really important because his midterms and final are based on what he says, not whats on the powerpoints. There's no assignments other than labs. So happy I got the chance to have him as a prof.

Chapleau is a great prof! He's so obviously passionate about his field of study which makes it very enjoyable to learn from him. Lectures are not mandatory, but highly encouraged, as he often uses examples from his lectures in his midterms and final.
Knowledgeable, enthusiastic
I literally switched my program to Biology because of him. He made me fall in love with Biology. Awesome prof, a real gem.
Great Prof!!
Amazing teacher, very clear and knowledgeable. You can tell he knows what he's talking about and loves to do what he does. Highly recommended for first years !!! Biology is now my favourite subject.

Dr. Chapleau is such funny prof. He's very enthusiastic about what he does, and he's very respectful and knowledgeable. The intro to bio class content is so boring, but he makes it something a little easier for you. He tells you exactly what to study for midterms and he will almost never deviate from that. Focus in class, and you'll be fine.

Great prof! My science-y friends highly recommended him, and he gave a solid introductory course. Very tough class if you did the minimum of science in high school, but a really good teacher who made it worthwhile. Gave extra marks to compensate for correction errors, and was very clear with expectations.
Super great prof, very fair exams and easy to listen to!!

Le meilleur professeur que j'ai eu de toute ma vie. Ses cours sont EXCELLENTS!!! Il inclus plusieurs exemples et beaucoup de photos dans ses Powerpoints ce qui facilite l'assimilation de la matière. Assiste au cours, prend de bonnes notes, relie tes notes, écoute les podcasts et tu vas bien réussir. Il est drôle, respectueux et gentil.
This prof is the most likeable guy I've ever met, I would take any class he teaches! Bio1530 is super easy if you like biology and if you show up to class.

En gros, j'ai aim le cours. Il est passionn par la matire et a parat. Vraiment, le seul point faible de la classe c'est que ses examens porte majoritairement sur des petits dtails vu en classe... De plus, dans la description de cours, ils disent que la matire est faite pour ceux n'ayant pas de background en biologie, ce qui est faux...

BEST PROF AT UOTTAWA BY FAR. He is super passionate about what he's teaching and it definitely comes across in his lectures. Make sure to take a lot of notes and listen to the podcasts again if you need to, he covers everything really thoroughly. Barely needed the textbook. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed. LOVE HIM

He's  passionate about what he's teaching, so when he's giving a lecture, the lack of monotony alone gets you engaged and ready to learn. He gives out indications on what will be on the exam, so write it down when he gives hints. He gives lots of examples too, which helped me learn way better than just focusing on the theory.

Chapleau is the most amazing prof I've ever had. He is very inspirational and wants his students to succeed. However, you do have do meet him halfway by trying to understand the material by yourself before going to see him for help. He uses tons of examples, which illustrates the concepts very well. This guy will make you fall in love with biology!

Favourite prof! He explains things very well and emphasizes the things that are important and will be on the exam. Content is straightforward and I love how he focuses on general concepts rather than pointless details. If you speak french then definitely take this course over bio1130 with Houseman!

There is a LOT to cover. But his lectures are funny and great to listen to. He is very passionate and he cares about making sure you know your stuff. Don't buy the book. You don't need it. Read his slides and listen to his podcasts, show up for class and ask questions.

Super passionate about what he teaches and uses tons of examples. Don't buy the textbook, you won't use it at all. Go to the lectures, he tells you in detail about what will be on the exams. If you can't make it, they're all recorded as podcasts. Awesome prof!!
He really was an awesome teacher! He always had an example for every concept in the course which made it very to understand and study.
My favorite prof ever, he's very clear and interesting, knows his material and his lectures are interesting :)

Maybe you'll find him weird at the beginning because he talks a lot about fish, but damn you will learn so much crazy stuff! To be honest you don't really need to go in class, everything is recorded. But don't study at the last minute, 'cause there's a lot of things. It's not hard, but you need to understand. Tests can be tricky.
Un trs bon prof, trs impassion et alors facile  couter. Ses diapos sont assez alors vous n'avez pas besoin du manuel de cours
Really good prof, just hate how he bashes religion but other than that, he is a good teacher. Do not buy the textbook however, it is useless.
He is a really good teacher. Not boring at all. Lectures are fun and easy to understand. He gives a lot of hints of what is going to be on the exams so pay attention to those!

Wow. un vrai professeur passionn,  enthousiaste, nergique. Dans une classe de 400 lves, il rpond aux questions et il VEUT que nous russissions. Il met tout, mais vraiment TOUT,  sur Blackboard. tudier en coutant ses balados est un plaisir. Il est inspirant, attentif et relit mme les concepts avec des exemples personelles de sa vie! 100%

The most passionate  prof ever. He knows his stuff and is very respected. He's happy to be there and really wants you to pass his class. Bit of a heavy class but hey it's Bio. He podcasts each and every class. Didn't buy the book. Great prof !

He is a really good prof. Truly cares about his students and answers his emails super fast. Be prepared to take a lot of notes. Lectures are interesting because of his passion of the subject. The multiple choice questions can be tricky, you need to study in advance. The PowerPoints alone are not enough you need to take a lot of notes.
hes so cute like a lil old grandpa he's so nice and cute and ssooooooooooooo passionate about the stuff he teaches! its all so fascinating!

I absolutely loved this class, and the teacher! M. Chapleau gives amazing lectures, is so passionate about his material and great at communicating it. Power points are extremely useful, the textbook is not necessary. Exams are pretty basic, you know what to expect. This was my favorite class by far, I would definitely take it again!!

son cours est trs intressant! il parle trs vite, mais si tu poses des questions, il va t'aider assurment. je vous conseille de prendre ce cours, mais vous allez avoir besoin d'tudier pour les examens, ils contiennent beaucoup de matire
Vraiment un bon prof
Very passionate prof and definitely here to help. You will need to study for the exams.

Great prof. There are MANY chapters to study for the final so start studying as soon as the second midterm has passed. Posts his lectures online so that's good but there's no video. Ppts have words missing.. He posts the ones with the words after a bit but don't count on that, just attend class because sometimes they're posted too late. GREAT PROF!

This was by far my favourite prof, he is amazing. It's important to go to class, his tests are composed of everything seen in class, I didn't find the need to use the textbook.  I would definitely recommend this prof and take more of his classes, he is amazing.
Bon proffeseur, il connait bien sa matire et nous la transmet bien. Si vous reviser vos notes vous aurez de bonne notes garantie.

He is an extremely nice and passionate prof, but I found that his exams were hard. There is a lot of detail to know and his style of teaching is very different from the norm, and I personally found it very hard to focus in his class because of it. Nice guy, but be sure to know EVERYTHING that's on his slides and write down what he says in class.

Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable! Take notes in class (I recommend printing the ppts  6 a page and taking notes around them). Know EVERYTHING on the ppts and his explanations/anecdotes, and you'll do great (you really need to know details though)! As an immersion student, he was easy to understand. Only used the textbook for the practice mcqs.

C'est un trs bon professeur. Ne pas sous-estimer l'usage du manuel (qui devient utile surtout pour les examens). Les dtails sont assez importants pour le cours. Le cours est beaucoup plus intressant grce  son nergie positive face  la matire. Bref, trs bon professeur.
You have to understand to have good grade and exam are not super easy. He is really passionate by biology. Best teacher of my semester.

The teacher is great you need to take notes though and go to class because things he mentions in class once or twice will be on the exams. He is fair but if you study two days in advance you won't do good. He talks quite fast but is super interesting and funny. I strongly recommend this teacher.

Il est passionn pour la biologie et l'environnement. Il fait beaucoup de liens avec l'actualits et avec beaucoup d'exemples. Assurez vous d'tre bien organis et de vous tenir  date dans vos choses. Les labos sont trs facile et aide incommensurablement  la moyenne. Le cours sert de connaissance gnrale, afin de mieux comprendre la science.
Easy class. Barely went to class and was still able to follow course material.

J'ai ador Dr. Chapleau ! Il est vraiment intressent et passionner pas sa matire. Gros cours quand mme, examen long et un peu difficile. Besoin de beaucoup d'tude. Je reprend son cours n'importe quand :D He really care for his students ! :)

Il est le meilleur professeur que vous aurez!!! Il est passionn, il te dit exactement ce qui va tre sur le test et il est trs clair et facile  suivre. Il est tout simplement incroyable. Tu ne vas jamais t'ennuy dans ses cours. Inutile de dire que je reprendrais ce cours sans hsitation.
Great teacher. Really seems to be passionate about the content of the course.
Funny lectures. He really knows his stuff and he's immensely passionate. I rarely get bored during his classes. He's pretty clear on what he wants on his midterms.  Doesn't try to fail you.
Francois knows what he's talking about!!
Amazing prof! Best I've had first year. His midterms are very easy if you took proper notes during the class. Passed with a 95!

He's so passionate about everything he talks about. It makes his class a lot more interesting than it would have been otherwise. Exams are pretty straightforward, lots of multiple choice questions. The textbook is humongous and pretty useless.

Dr. Chapleau connait vraiment son sujet et est vraiment dynamique. Il explique toujours les concepts  l'aide de 3 exemples pour tre certain que l'on comprend bien en plus de rpondre rapidement  ses courriels. Il affiche la structure des examens sur blackboard et indique quels chapitres tudier. Il est juste dans sa faon de corriger les examens

Best prof I had in my first year!! Incredible lectures (even if you're not that interested in biology), lots of picturesvideo examples to aid in his explanation. However, to do very well, you MUST take your own notes since not everything he says is on the slides. For the tests: UNDERSTAND the material, don't just memorize.
Great prof! I absolutely loved him. Very clear when he teaches and his passion just shines through his lectures. Would definitely recommend!

As a French Immersion student, I was nervous taking Biology in French but Chapleau is very clear and his lectures are not boring. His exams are fair , make sure you study the examples he provides in class. He also posts lecture recordings so listen to them again before the midterms and exams

His class is not extremely hard but just be ready to put the work in. He does look for key words in his exams but is not unreasonable as some people have suggested. The words he looks for are essential to have a good understanding of the material. With some good studying it's possible to do very well in his class. Finished with a 94%

Absolutely amazing prof; very passionate about the subject. I found the material to be really interesting. The TAs were quite hard on us, and they definitely make you work for it. Pay close attention to the lectures, take notes on what he says that isn't on the slides. As an FI student, his speed and accent were difficult but you get used to it.

Absolutely LOVED his classes! Chapleau made me want to study more and be more involved. Studied a lot and did really well in my exams. Would recommend it to anyone interested even ever so slightly in Biology. Need to memories a lot of the key words as mentioned below but also really need to understand the concepts. Finished the class with 80%.
Meilleur prof!! Excellent! Best! Extraordinaire! Concepts are essentials! Professor Chapleau is always there to answer emails and answer questions to help students
Very enthusiastic and passionate professor whoever the exams and final are corrected based on a very strict word bank

A+ He is very knowledgeable about the topic and often uses his own experience in the field as examples. His lectures are well prepared and he's fun to listen to, he doesn't just read off of the slides. By my favorite of two teachers since middleschool. The tests aren't that hard if you study, but watch out for trick wording. Would retake the class.

This professor is amazing. His lectures are interesting and he is super engaging as a teacher. Pay attention to his examples, they are without fail the bulk of his examination material, he'll also give you hints. You defintely do not need to go to his lectures, because he posts the podcasts.

Very passionate about the subject. Made me want to learn more and to do well in his class. Lectures are always fun. He seems to really care about the students and does everything he can to make sure they do well.

Chapleau was a great prof. The way he explains things in class is very clear and he makes sure that you understand. However I didn't have much interest in the class, the subjects covered weren't particularly interesting to me. Also he does hint a lot at whats going to be on the test, so attend lectures!

Questions are more application-based. He wants to you understand the concept and doesn't put too much emphasis on memorization. Personally struggled initially (FI student), but he's very approachable and helped me to understand how I could improve. Definitely glad I took this as my course in french.

Professor Chapleau is amazing! He's got a great sense of humour and an obvious passion for biology. As a professor, he cares about the students  and his bell curves are golden. The TAs are tough graders though, so make sure you study well and pay attention in class! If he spends a lot of time talking about something, it's probably on the test.

I took this class knowing that I was going to struggle through it bc it wasn't in my native language (English), but Chapleau always posted the recorded lectures and assured me that I could answer midterms and exams in EnglishFrench. He's passionate about what he teaches, lectures are long but can be interesting, and he bell curves! Best prof ever.

I always liked biology but then I took this class and hated it. You need to be very specific on your exams, if you don't use the exact words he wants you wont get points. I know a lot of people in my class who also failedstruggled a lot. I'm passing all my other classes with good grades but no matter how much I study for his exams I never do good

Il est fantastique! Trs passionn! Je recommande ce cours  tout le monde! Vous devez tout de mme concentrer  et bien tudier pour passer.  Il est trs claire, prcis et donnes de nombreux exemples. Matire dans l'examen est directement li aux cours en classe. Il poste les notes sur Blackboard et les enregistrement du cours.
Hardest TA's ever...
tough grader, tough tests
He is really passionnate about his job and cares for his students.
He is a tough grader
Great class with what I would call the best prof !
Great teacher, great class (if you like Bio). He's really involved in what he's teaching.

Favorite Teacher to date! I actually look forward to going to his classes. His multiple questions can be pretty tricky, but his development questions are often things he spent a long time teaching. Listened well in class and only studied 3 hours in total for the mid term exam and passed with a good grade!

Really nice prof. You should go see him during office hours. For the class, you have to know the slides by heart and the key words. Midterms and final are horrible though, they can really destroy you because if you don't explain it the way it was written in the slides, you're screwed. Again, don't forget mot-cles!

Prof vraiment intressant et centr sur sa matire. Il est trs professionnel et sait s'adapter  ses tudiants. Trs bonnes explications. Matires des examens centrs sur les dtails. C'est un excellent prof de biologie :)
Class is fun but midterms are hell! They tell you to understand everything in class yet all he wants are the ''mots cls'' which is nonsense

Passionate about what he teaches, interesting class, pretty straight forward about what we'll be tested on, bit of a tough class but if you pay attention then you know what you're in for. Very personal with his students.
awesome prof, made every lecture fun and energetic.
Excellent professeur. Il vulgarise trs bien la matire. J'ai beaucoup appris dans ce cours de biologie.

Really good prof. Highly reccomend his class. Even though the corrections done on the exam are not always Just, his bonus points make up for It? Besides That prof Is ALWAYS available for help no matter what. Really patient guy, and wants his students to really succeed. One of the best profs. Highly reccomend. No need for textbook.
Good teacher, always available to answer questions, evaluations are relatively easy as long as you study.

In all, a very good professor. He makes the material very interesting and includes relevant videos that keep the class interesting. He answers questions and replies to emails promptly. His classes are never dull. I recommend this class for anyone who needs to take Biology. His tests are built on the sections of the notes he refers to, no surprises.

Excellent prof! Il est vraiment passionn de ce qu'il enseigne! Ses cours deviennent longs parfois mais il fait souvent des blagues ici et l et a rend le cours plus intressant :) Il est trs sympathique et toujours prt  rpondre  tes questions  son bureau ou par courriel. Ses examens sont difficiles mais il s'agit juste de bien tudier!
Tres interessant et comique :) jadore qu'il captive les aspects visuels en incluant des videos pertinant :)
Just know your powerpoint slides and it's an easy-ish A
Il est un excellent prof de Bio. Ca parait qu'il aime ce qu'il fait et il adore partager sa passion avec nous. Tu sais toujours  quoi t'attendre de lui.

tres bon prof! il explique sa matire. la correction des examens ne fait pas toujours justice, mais j'ai eu bcp plus pire comme prof de bio (petit-turcotte). c'est pas tres facile de predire a quoi il s'attend comme reponse dans ces examens

Obsede avec ses poissons-plats mais un merveilleux prof qui veux que ces tudiants russissent! Trop gentil, rpond bien aux questions, donne des points extra aux examens aux cas ou que les correcteurs/TA font erreurs!
Un des meilleurs enseigants que j'ai eu. Ces exemples sont trs pertinentes et ses attentes sont claires.

Nicest prof ever. He's great at explaining everything and his midterms and exam are very fair. He's funny and really knows what he's talking about. I would definitely recommend taking his class, he's amazing.
C'est explication sont clair. Il rpond bien aux questions. Ces examens sont durs et prcis

Amazing prof, extremely helpful when you email him. Such a nice guy, funny and knows what hes doing. Dont study 1 day before the midterms like I did, bad idea. The final exam has a lot of material covered so get studying ASAP

Meillleur professeur que j'ai eu  l'universit ! Trs clair et passionn par la biologie et par l'intrt des tudiants  apprendre. Il apporte beaucoup d'exemples et anecdotes interessantes. Il est facile de l'couter et d'apprendre avec ce professeur.
Exams are hard, make sure you attend the classes. He's cute and makes lots of witty jokes, the class itself was kinda boring. Best advice I could give is listen to the podcasts or read the book.
Absolutely amazing! His examples are great, and he adds really memorable details and important information. He also gives hints at what concepts are important for the exam. Highly recommend him!

Best teacher ever! The notes are very clear and he is very clear on what you need to study for the exam especially if you listen in class. The first were exams were very easy and had an average in the 70's. The final had a lot to study for and probably had an average in the 60's which is still good for a University course.Highly recommend this prof

One of the best profs I've had in my first year, definitely loves what he does and wants his students to succeed. He is very clear on what to expect of his exams. Its a lot of memorizing but fairly easy to do well. He also loves fish! lol One of the best profs!!! :)
What had been said below. He is a very helpful, enthusiastic and resourceful teacher. Haven't had a biology teacher as good as him.
Un prof trs passion et intressant. Il explique trs bien la matire avec des exemples pertinants. En gros, LE MEILLEUR PROF DE BIOLOGIE!!

Love him and loved his class! I did really well in that class too, because I retyped all my notes like he suggested to do. Takes a lot of time but guarantees you at least a B+... His notes are super clear, he's interesting to listen to, he's funny, etc, etc. I want to switch to a bio program now so I can have him all the time :P

Best professor I've had so far! He is absolutly hilarious and you can tell he really wants to be up there teaching. Exams are not the hardest but not the easiest either.  I would recommend this prof to everyone!!!
the best teacher I ever had
Passionate about the subject, great examples (they come back in the midterms/exams!). Organised slides, attendance mandatory to fill in the blanks. Decent exams. Overall a good prof, easy class.
Passionate about the subject, great examples (they come back in the midterms/exams!). Organised slides, attendance mandatory to fill in the blanks. Decent exams. Overall a good prof, easy class.
Passionate about the subject, great examples (they come back in the midterms/exams!). Organised slides, attendance mandatory to fill in the blanks. Decent exams. Overall a good prof, easy class.
Fantastic prof. He is really into what he teaches and provides you with all the resources you need to do well, if you make the effort. He can also be really funny at times :)
Interesting class, very knowledgeable professor. Very nice, gives all you need to do good. Amazing professor overall

Excellent teacher. Knows his stuff. Has great slides and explains them well, with various examples, videos. Is very clear about what is likely to be on the exam, gives hints during classes. Lectures are important to properly understand the material. He posts them on the internet, so you can re-listen to them and take notes. And he's SO CUTE.
This teacher is awesome. Clear, friendly and very available to students for questions. He loves his stuff and it shows.

Communique sa matire de faon inefficace. Il perd son temps avec des exemples vraiment compliqus, mais il n'explique jamais son ide principale en dtail. EXTRMEMENT difficile de rester attentif en classe. Ses examens sont bons par exemple, si tu connais toutes les diapos par coeur t'es bon.
he loves fish. all examples given are with fish. but he's able to laugh about the fact he loves fish.
